summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2019 within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, primarily concerning travel approval requests for federal agents and prosecutors to conduct victim interviews in Florida and Los Angeles as part of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). It reveals the logistical planning and authorization process for investigative travel.

connections.description: Colleagues working together as part of the investigative/prosecutorial team traveling to conduct victim interviews for the Epstein case.

events.title: Planned Travel for Florida Victim Interviews
events.description: Travel planned for a combination of team members (S, M, and possibly others) to Palm Beach, Florida, from Thursday through Sunday to conduct victim interviews for the Epstein investigation. A conference room at a hotel was also requested.

events.title: Planned Travel for Los Angeles Victim Interview
events.description: Travel tentatively planned for the following week (from a June 12, 2019, email) for a victim interview in Los Angeles, with team members S, M, and/or others flying down Wednesday and returning by Friday.

events.title: Planned Travel for Florida Meetings and Interviews
events.description: Travel requested (from a May 24, 2019, email) for approximately three days the following week for meetings and interviews with victims in West Palm Beach, Florida, involving team members S and others.

events.title: Travel for Florida Meetings and Interviews
events.description: Travel requested (from an April 3, 2019, email) for approximately three days the following week for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Initial Travel for Florida Meetings
events.description: Initial travel request (from a March 14, 2019, email) for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for the Epstein investigation.

locations: Southern District of New York (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The document shows active federal investigation (case 2018R01618, United States v. Epstein) into Epstein for enticement of minors for sexual activity was ongoing through at least July 2019.
Federal prosecutors and agents were traveling to Florida and California to conduct victim interviews, indicating a multi-jurisdictional effort to gather evidence.
The travel requests were routine and required formal approval, highlighting the bureaucratic process within the U.S. Attorney's Office.
The team consistently requested hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews, suggesting formal, private settings for speaking with victims.
The email chain spans from March to July 2019, showing sustained investigative activity over several months.
